meanings.definition: To assign a disadvantage to someone or something in order to equalize competition.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was handicapping the students by giving extra help to those who struggled.
meanings.sent2: The referee was accused of handicapping one team by making biased calls.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun was handicapping the race by secretly tying the shoelaces of the fastest runner together.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain handicapped the outdoor concert, causing many attendees to leave early.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick handicapped the volunteer by making them unable to speak for a few minutes.

meanings.definition: The act of predicting the outcome of a competition, especially in sports, by analyzing and evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of participants.
meanings.sent1: His handicapping of the game was so accurate that he won the office pool every time.
meanings.sent2: Many fans enjoy the excitement of handicapping matches before they start.
meanings.sent3: The cat's handicapping of the mouse race led to unexpected results.
meanings.sent4: Her handicapping of the chess tournament was like seeing into the future.
meanings.sent5: The expert's handicapping of the race made him a sought-after consultant for sports teams.

meanings.definition: A system of assigning weights to horses in a race based on their past performance in order to equalize their chances of winning.
meanings.sent1: The handicapping system in horse racing ensures a fair competition for all participants.
meanings.sent2: Fans eagerly awaited the release of the handicapping results for the upcoming race.
meanings.sent3: The comical horse named Buttercup always managed to outsmart the handicapping system.
meanings.sent4: The handicapping process in horse racing is like a strategic game of chess.
meanings.sent5: The jockey's understanding of the handicapping system gave him an edge in the race.
